document_title: Bone spurs: Causes, symptoms and treatments
subsection_name: gai-xuong.json_7_How to care and recover for people with bone spurs
subsection_content:
In addition to following the doctor's treatment regimen, patients should also build healthy living habits. In particular, maintaining a suitable weight is necessary to reduce pressure on damaged joints and bones.
Combining exercise with a diet that includes foods rich in nutrients that are good for bones and joints such as calcium, vitamin D and omega-3... will contribute to helping patients improve their health condition. Besides, don't forget to abstain from alcohol and some foods high in sugar, salt or saturated fat to avoid making symptoms of pain and inflammation worse.
